column2: ARKANSAS DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: Arkansas
column6: AR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Reversible lane ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: The divided highway ends ahead.

column2: 2. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 3. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: does not increase the chance of a crash.
column8: often leads to high-risk decision-making.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Steep downgrade
column6: No right turn
column8: You must turn right

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 6. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a traffic enforcement officer.
column6: a deaf person.
column8: a blind person.

column2: 7. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
column6: can block traffic.
column8: is a good defensive driving technique.

column2: 8. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 9. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 10. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column8: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 11. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
column6: treat others the way you want to be treated.
column8: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.

column2: 12. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Locking Brake System
column6: Average-Beam System
column8: Anti-Braking System

column2: 13. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column2: 14. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hospital service
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities
column8: Interstate highway

column2: 15. To make a proper right turn:
column4: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column6: swing to the left before turning right.
column8: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.

column2: 16. The road is the most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column6: after it rains.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.

column2: 18. A yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
column4: Drivers are not required to signal before turning from that lane.
column6: Increase your speed to make the turn before the light changes.
column8: Be prepared to stop and give the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down or stop

column2: 20. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: a divided highway ends ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 21. If weather requires you to have your lights on, you should use your:
column4: high beams.
column6: low beams.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Stop
column6: Traffic signal ahead
column8: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 23. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 24. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a side road.
column6: a cross road.
column8: a sharp turn.
